Support.heroSubtitle: Find answers to common questions or get in touch with our support team.
Support.categoryBookingDescription: How to book, modify, or cancel your rental
Support.categoryRideshareDescription: Resources for Uber, Lyft & delivery drivers
Support.faqAnswerText1: ItWhip is a peer-to-peer car rental platform. Local car owners list their vehicles, and you can rent directly from them. All rentals include $1M liability insurance, and our platform handles payments, verification, and support.
Support.faqAnswer1Before: ItWhip is a peer-to-peer car rental platform. Local car owners list their vehicles, and you can rent directly from them. All rentals include
Support.faqAnswer1After: , and our platform handles payments, verification, and support.
Support.faqAnswerText2: Every ItWhip rental includes $1M liability coverage. Hosts can also offer additional comprehensive and collision protection. You can bring your own insurance for a 50% security deposit discount.
Support.faqAnswer2Before: Every ItWhip rental includes $1M liability coverage. Hosts can also offer additional comprehensive and collision protection. You can bring your own insurance for a 50% security deposit discount.
Support.faqQuestion3: What are the requirements to rent?
Support.faqAnswerText3: You must be 21+ years old (25+ for some vehicles), have a valid driver's license, clean driving record, and a verified payment method. International licenses are accepted with proper documentation.
Support.faqAnswer3Before: You must be 21+ years old (25+ for some vehicles), have a valid driver's license, clean driving record, and a verified payment method. International licenses are accepted with proper documentation.
Support.faqAnswerText4: Many hosts offer free delivery to airports, hotels, and homes. During booking, you'll coordinate the pickup location with your host. Some hosts require you to pick up at their location.
Support.faqAnswer4Before: Many hosts offer free delivery to airports, hotels, and homes. During booking, you'll coordinate the pickup location with your host. Some hosts require you to pick up at their location.
Support.faqQuestion5: What if there's damage to the vehicle?
Support.faqAnswerText5: Report any damage immediately through the app. Take photos before and after your trip. Our damage process protects both guests and hosts with fair resolution. See our detailed damage process page.
Support.faqAnswer5Before: Report any damage immediately through the app. Take photos before and after your trip. Our damage process protects both guests and hosts with fair resolution.
Support.faqQuestion6: How do I cancel a reservation?
Support.faqAnswerText6: You can cancel through the app or website. Refund amounts depend on when you cancel - full refund up to 24 hours before, partial refund within 24 hours. See our cancellation policy for details.
Support.faqAnswer6Before: You can cancel through the app or website. Refund amounts depend on when you cancel - full refund up to 24 hours before, partial refund within 24 hours.
Support.faqAnswerText7: We accept all major credit cards (Visa, Mastercard, Amex, Discover). Debit cards are accepted for verified users. We do not accept cash, prepaid cards, or PayPal at this time.
Support.faqAnswer7Before: We accept all major credit cards (Visa, Mastercard, Amex, Discover). Debit cards are accepted for verified users. We do not accept cash, prepaid cards, or PayPal.
Support.faqAnswerText8: Mileage limits vary by host and are clearly shown on each listing. Most offer 150-250 miles per day. Additional miles are charged at the rate specified in the listing.
Support.faqAnswer8Before: Mileage limits vary by host and are clearly shown on each listing. Most offer 150-250 miles per day. Additional miles are charged at the rate specified in the listing.
Support.supportAvailable: Our support team is available 24/7 to assist you.

SupportBooking.title: How to Book a Car
SupportBooking.subtitle: Step-by-step booking guide
SupportBooking.stepDescription1: Enter your location, dates, and times. Browse available vehicles in your area with filters for car type, price, and features.
SupportBooking.stepDescription2: Review vehicle details, photos, host ratings, and included mileage. Check the pickup location and any special requirements.
SupportBooking.stepDescription3: Confirm your pickup and return dates and times. Most hosts offer flexible scheduling and free delivery options.
SupportBooking.stepDescription4: Enter your payment information and accept the rental agreement. Your card will be charged once the host confirms.
SupportBooking.stepDescription5: Receive instant confirmation with host contact info. Coordinate pickup details directly with your host.

SupportClaims.title: File a Claim
SupportClaims.subtitle: Report damage, theft, or accidents
SupportClaims.stepDescription1: Take photos and videos of any damage from multiple angles. Include the surrounding area and any other vehicles involved.
SupportClaims.stepDescription2: For accidents, theft, or vandalism, file a police report. Get the report number for your claim.
SupportClaims.stepDescription3: Open the ItWhip app, go to your trip, and select "Report an Issue." Upload photos and describe what happened.
SupportClaims.stepDescription4: Our claims team will review your submission within 24-48 hours and contact you with next steps.
SupportClaims.whatToIncludeTitle: What to Include in Your Claim
SupportClaims.claimInclude2: Date, time, and location of incident
SupportClaims.claimInclude5: Contact info of other parties involved

SupportCleaningPolicy.heroSubtitle: Keep it clean, keep it simple. Understand our return standards and avoid unexpected charges.
SupportCleaningPolicy.goldenRuleText: Return the car in the same condition you received it. That's it—no professional detailing required, just basic respect for the vehicle.
SupportCleaningPolicy.doItem3: Shake out floor mats if sandy/dirty
SupportCleaningPolicy.doItem4: Wipe up any spills or sticky spots
SupportCleaningPolicy.doItem7: Report any issues to host immediately
SupportCleaningPolicy.dontItem1: Smoke or vape in the vehicle
SupportCleaningPolicy.dontItem4: Return with excessive sand or mud
SupportCleaningPolicy.noSmokingDesc: All ItWhip vehicles are smoke-free. This includes cigarettes, cigars, vapes, and cannabis.
SupportCleaningPolicy.noSmokingFee: Violation fee: $250 minimum + odor removal costs
SupportCleaningPolicy.petPolicyDesc: Only allowed in vehicles marked "pet-friendly." Always use a carrier or seat cover.
SupportCleaningPolicy.foodDrinksDesc: Eating is allowed but clean up after yourself. Spills should be wiped immediately.
SupportCleaningPolicy.feeExamples1: Sand, light dirt, food crumbs, minor spills
SupportCleaningPolicy.feeDesc1: Vehicle needs more than a basic wipe-down
SupportCleaningPolicy.feeExamples2: Significant dirt, sticky residue, stains requiring treatment
SupportCleaningPolicy.feeExamples3: Pet hair, smoke odor, major stains, biohazard cleanup
SupportCleaningPolicy.feeDesc3: Extensive professional cleaning with odor removal
SupportCleaningPolicy.feeExamples4: Cigarette burns, permanent stains, odor requiring ozone treatment
SupportCleaningPolicy.feeDesc4: May require multiple treatments or part replacement
SupportCleaningPolicy.feeDisclaimer: Fees are deducted from your security deposit. Excessive cleaning may result in deposit forfeiture plus additional charges.
SupportCleaningPolicy.disputeIntro: If you believe a cleaning fee is unfair, you can dispute it within 48 hours of being charged:
SupportCleaningPolicy.disputeStep1: Review the photos provided by the host documenting the issue
SupportCleaningPolicy.disputeStep2: Compare with your own pickup/return photos (this is why we recommend always taking them!)
SupportCleaningPolicy.disputeStep3: Submit your dispute through the app with your evidence
SupportCleaningPolicy.disputeStep4: ItWhip support reviews both sides and makes a fair determination
SupportCleaningPolicy.disputeStep5: Decision is typically made within 3-5 business days
SupportCleaningPolicy.faqQuestion1: What condition should I return the car in?
SupportCleaningPolicy.faqAnswer1: Return the car in the same general condition you received it. Remove all personal belongings, trash, and any sand/dirt you brought in. A basic wipe-down of any spills is appreciated but professional cleaning isn't expected.
SupportCleaningPolicy.faqQuestion2: Are pets allowed in ItWhip rentals?
SupportCleaningPolicy.faqAnswer2: It depends on the host. Some hosts welcome pets (look for the "pet-friendly" badge), while others don't allow them. Never bring a pet in a non-pet-friendly vehicle—this results in automatic deep cleaning fees.
SupportCleaningPolicy.faqQuestion3: What if I smoke in the car?
SupportCleaningPolicy.faqAnswer3: Smoking (including vaping) is prohibited in all ItWhip vehicles. Violation results in a minimum $250 cleaning fee plus potential odor removal costs. Repeat offenders may be banned from the platform.
SupportCleaningPolicy.faqQuestion4: How do I avoid cleaning fees?
SupportCleaningPolicy.faqAnswer4: Simple: return it as you found it. Remove trash, shake out floor mats if sandy, wipe up spills, and don't smoke or bring unauthorized pets. Take photos at return to document condition.
SupportCleaningPolicy.faqQuestion5: What if the car was already dirty when I got it?
SupportCleaningPolicy.faqAnswer5: Always document the vehicle condition at pickup with photos/video. If it's significantly dirty, contact the host immediately and report through the app. This protects you from being charged for pre-existing issues.
SupportCleaningPolicy.faqAnswer6: Hosts document condition at return with photos. If cleaning is needed, they submit a claim with documentation. ItWhip reviews the evidence and determines fair charges based on our fee guidelines.
SupportCleaningPolicy.proTip1Desc: A plastic grocery bag in the door pocket makes cleanup easy
SupportCleaningPolicy.proTip2Desc: Prevent spills by keeping drinks secured
SupportCleaningPolicy.proTip3Desc: Even in pet-friendly cars, protect the seats
SupportCleaningPolicy.proTip4Desc: 2 minutes with a napkin can save you $50+
SupportCleaningPolicy.ctaSubtitle: Contact us before your trip if you have any concerns about cleanliness standards.

SupportDamageProcess.heroSubtitle: We hope you never need this page, but if something happens, here's how we handle it fairly for everyone.
SupportDamageProcess.preventionDesc: Always take detailed photos before and after your trip. Document the vehicle's condition using the app - this protects both you and the host if any disputes arise.
SupportDamageProcess.step1Desc: Take photos and videos of the damage from multiple angles. Include wide shots and close-ups. Document the date, time, and location.
SupportDamageProcess.step1Tip2: Include photos of the full vehicle for context
SupportDamageProcess.step1Tip3: Get photos of any other vehicles involved
SupportDamageProcess.step2Desc: Report the damage through the ItWhip app or call our 24/7 support line. Do not delay - prompt reporting helps with claims.
SupportDamageProcess.step2Tip3: Get a police report for accidents
SupportDamageProcess.step2Tip4: Exchange info with other parties if applicable
SupportDamageProcess.step3Desc: Complete the damage claim form with all details. Upload your photos, police report (if applicable), and describe what happened.
SupportDamageProcess.step3Tip3: Keep receipts for any out-of-pocket expenses
SupportDamageProcess.step3Tip4: Respond promptly to any follow-up questions
SupportDamageProcess.step4Desc: Our team reviews all claims within 48 hours. We work with both parties to reach a fair resolution based on evidence and policies.
SupportDamageProcess.step4Tip1: Most claims resolved within 5-7 business days
SupportDamageProcess.step4Tip2: You'll receive updates via email and app
SupportDamageProcess.step4Tip4: Coverage depends on protection plan selected
SupportDamageProcess.basicCoverageDesc: Included with every rental. You're responsible for damage up to this amount.
SupportDamageProcess.standardProtectionDesc: Reduced deductible. Recommended for most renters.
SupportDamageProcess.premiumProtectionDesc: Maximum peace of mind. Lowest deductible available.
SupportDamageProcess.faqAnswer1: Damage includes any new scratches, dents, stains, mechanical issues, or other changes to the vehicle's condition from when you received it. Pre-existing damage documented in the check-in photos is not your responsibility.
SupportDamageProcess.faqQuestion2: How much will I be charged for damage?
SupportDamageProcess.faqAnswer2: Charges depend on the repair cost and your protection plan. With basic coverage, you may be responsible for a deductible up to $2,500. Premium protection reduces this to $500 or less. We only charge actual repair costs - never inflated estimates.
SupportDamageProcess.faqQuestion3: What if the host claims damage I didn't cause?
SupportDamageProcess.faqAnswer3: This is why check-in and check-out photos are crucial. If you have documentation showing the damage existed before your trip, submit it with your response. Our team reviews all evidence from both parties to make a fair determination.
SupportDamageProcess.faqQuestion4: Am I responsible for tire/wheel damage?
SupportDamageProcess.faqAnswer4: Generally, yes. Tire punctures, curb rash on wheels, and similar damage during your trip is typically guest responsibility. However, wear-and-tear issues like worn treads are the host's responsibility.
SupportDamageProcess.faqQuestion5: What about interior damage or cleaning?
SupportDamageProcess.faqAnswer5: Excessive cleaning fees (beyond normal use) may be charged. This includes stains, odors, excessive pet hair, or trash left in the vehicle. Normal use wear is expected and not charged.
SupportDamageProcess.faqQuestion6: How does insurance work with damage claims?
SupportDamageProcess.faqAnswer6: ItWhip's $1M liability coverage protects you for third-party claims. For vehicle damage, your personal auto insurance or the protection plan you selected during booking applies. We'll guide you through the process.
SupportDamageProcess.faqQuestion7: Can I dispute a damage claim?
SupportDamageProcess.faqAnswer7: Yes. You have 48 hours to respond to any damage claim with your evidence. If you disagree with the resolution, you can request a review by our Trust & Safety team.
SupportDamageProcess.faqQuestion8: What if I'm in an accident?
SupportDamageProcess.faqAnswer8: First, ensure everyone is safe and call 911 if needed. Get a police report, document everything, and contact ItWhip support immediately. Do not admit fault at the scene. Our team will guide you through next steps.
SupportDamageProcess.emergencyDesc: If there are injuries, call 911 first. Then contact us.

SupportDeposits.heroSubtitle: Understand how deposits work, when they're charged, and how to get them back quickly.
SupportDeposits.keyPointDesc1: Deposits protect hosts from damage and guests from unfair charges.
SupportDeposits.keyPointDesc2: After a successful trip, deposits are released within 3-7 business days.
SupportDeposits.keyPointDesc3: Verified personal insurance can reduce your deposit by half.
SupportDeposits.stepDesc1: Deposit is authorized (held) on your card 24-48 hours before pickup
SupportDeposits.stepDesc2: Hold remains in place while you enjoy your rental
SupportDeposits.stepDesc3: Host inspects vehicle and confirms return condition
SupportDeposits.stepDesc4: If no issues, hold is released within 3-7 business days
SupportDeposits.depositDisclaimer: Exact deposit amounts are set by individual hosts and displayed before booking confirmation.
SupportDeposits.reduceTitle: How to Reduce Your Deposit by 50%
SupportDeposits.reduceIntro: If you have personal auto insurance that covers rental vehicles, you can qualify for a 50% deposit reduction. Here's how:
SupportDeposits.reduceStep1: During booking, select "I have my own insurance"
SupportDeposits.reduceStep2: Upload a photo of your declarations page or insurance card
SupportDeposits.reduceStep3: Our team verifies coverage within 24 hours
SupportDeposits.reduceStep4: Approved coverage automatically reduces your deposit
SupportDeposits.reduceInsuranceNote: Qualifying insurance must include: Collision coverage, comprehensive coverage, and rental car coverage. Minimum liability limits apply.
SupportDeposits.deductionsTitle: What Can Be Deducted From Your Deposit?
SupportDeposits.deductDesc1: Dents, scratches, interior damage beyond normal wear
SupportDeposits.deductDesc2: Smoke smell, stains, pet hair, excessive dirt
SupportDeposits.deductDesc3: Additional daily rate charges for unapproved late returns
SupportDeposits.deductDesc5: Parking tickets, red light violations, speeding tickets
SupportDeposits.deductDesc6: Extra miles beyond your booked allocation
SupportDeposits.deductDesc7: Refueling to agreed level if not returned full
SupportDeposits.deductDesc8: Keys, garage remotes, or charging cables
SupportDeposits.faqQuestion1: When is my security deposit charged?
SupportDeposits.faqAnswer1: Your security deposit is authorized (not charged) when your booking is confirmed, typically 24-48 hours before pickup. This creates a temporary hold on your card. If no damage or extra charges occur, the hold is released after the trip ends.
SupportDeposits.faqQuestion2: How do I get my deposit back?
SupportDeposits.faqAnswer2: If the vehicle is returned in the same condition, your deposit hold is automatically released within 3-7 business days after trip completion. Some banks may show the release immediately, while others take longer to process.
SupportDeposits.faqQuestion3: Can I reduce my deposit amount?
SupportDeposits.faqAnswer3: Yes! Guests with verified personal auto insurance can receive a 50% deposit reduction. Simply upload proof of your insurance coverage during the booking process, and we'll verify it qualifies.
SupportDeposits.faqQuestion4: What can the deposit be used for?
SupportDeposits.faqAnswer4: The deposit covers potential damage to the vehicle, excessive cleaning fees, late returns, toll violations, traffic tickets, mileage overages, and fuel replacement if not returned at the agreed level.
SupportDeposits.faqQuestion5: Why is a hold different from a charge?
SupportDeposits.faqAnswer5: An authorization hold temporarily reserves funds but doesn't transfer money. It appears as "pending" on your statement. Unlike a charge, holds automatically expire and release back to your available balance.
SupportDeposits.faqQuestion6: What if my card doesn't have enough for the deposit?
SupportDeposits.faqAnswer6: Your booking may be cancelled if the authorization fails. We recommend ensuring sufficient available credit before your trip. If you have concerns, contact support before booking.
SupportDeposits.ctaSubtitle: Our support team is happy to help with any deposit-related concerns.

SupportExtendRental.title: Extend Your Rental
SupportExtendRental.subtitle: Need more time with your car?
SupportExtendRental.howToExtendStep1: Open the ItWhip app and go to "My Trips"
SupportExtendRental.howToExtendStep2: Find your current rental and tap "Extend Trip"
SupportExtendRental.howToExtendStep3: Select your new return date and time
SupportExtendRental.howToExtendStep4: Review the additional cost and confirm
SupportExtendRental.howToExtendStep5: Wait for host approval (usually within 1 hour)
SupportExtendRental.requirement1: Request must be made before your current return time
SupportExtendRental.requirement2: Vehicle must be available (no conflicting bookings)
SupportExtendRental.requirement4: Your payment method must be valid for additional charges
SupportExtendRental.requirement5: Same rental terms apply to the extended period
SupportExtendRental.pricingDescription: Extensions are charged at the same daily rate as your original booking. If extending for multiple days, weekly discounts may apply if offered by the host.
SupportExtendRental.pricingItem1: • Daily rate: Same as original booking
SupportExtendRental.pricingItem2: • Mileage: Additional miles added to your allowance
SupportExtendRental.lateReturnsDescription: Returning late without an approved extension may result in late fees and could affect your account standing. If you know you'll be late, request an extension as soon as possible or contact the host directly.

SupportInsurance.heroSubtitle: Get answers to your insurance questions, learn how to file a claim, and contact our support team.
SupportInsurance.fileClaimTitle: How to File an Insurance Claim
SupportInsurance.claimStep1Desc: Open the ItWhip app, go to your trip, and tap "Report Issue." The sooner you report, the faster we can help.
SupportInsurance.claimStep2Desc: Take photos of all damage from multiple angles. Get the other party's information if applicable. Note the time, location, and circumstances.
SupportInsurance.claimStep3Desc: Complete the in-app claim form with photos and description. For Tier 2/3 hosts, also file with your primary insurance.
SupportInsurance.claimStep4Desc: Our claims team reviews within 24-48 hours. You'll receive updates via email and in-app notifications.
SupportInsurance.lateReportingWarning: Report incidents as soon as possible. Late reporting (more than 24 hours) may affect your claim. For emergencies involving injuries, call 911 first.
SupportInsurance.claimsHierarchyDesc: Claims follow an insurance hierarchy based on the host's tier:
SupportInsurance.tier1Desc: Platform insurance is PRIMARY → File claim with ItWhip
SupportInsurance.tier2Desc: Your P2P insurance is PRIMARY → File with your insurer first, then ItWhip as backup
SupportInsurance.tier3Desc: Your commercial insurance is PRIMARY → File with your insurer first, then ItWhip as backup
SupportInsurance.faqQuestion1: How do I file an insurance claim?
SupportInsurance.faqAnswer1: Report the incident immediately through the ItWhip app by going to your trip details and selecting "Report Issue." Upload photos of any damage, provide a description of what happened, and submit. Our claims team will review within 24-48 hours.
SupportInsurance.faqAnswer2: Deductibles depend on your host tier: Tier 1 (Platform Insurance) = $2,500 collision / $1,000 comprehensive. Tier 2 (P2P) and Tier 3 (Commercial) = your own policy deductibles apply first, with platform backup coverage.
SupportInsurance.faqQuestion3: What does insurance cover during a trip?
SupportInsurance.faqAnswer3: Coverage includes: liability (bodily injury & property damage to third parties), collision damage to the rental vehicle, comprehensive coverage (theft, vandalism, weather), and 24/7 roadside assistance. Coverage is active ONLY during booked rental periods.
SupportInsurance.faqAnswer4: Not covered: mechanical breakdowns, pre-existing damage, personal belongings, intentional damage, DUI incidents, unauthorized drivers, off-road use, and any use outside the rental period. Normal wear and tear is also excluded.
SupportInsurance.faqQuestion5: How long does a claim take to process?
SupportInsurance.faqAnswer5: Most claims are resolved within 48-72 hours. Complex claims involving third parties or disputes may take 5-7 business days. You'll receive updates via email and in-app notifications throughout the process.
SupportInsurance.faqQuestion6: What if my claim is denied?
SupportInsurance.faqAnswer6: If your primary insurance denies a claim, platform secondary coverage may still apply. You can appeal a denial by providing additional documentation. Contact our claims team at info@itwhip.com for assistance.
SupportInsurance.faqQuestion7: Do guests need their own insurance?
SupportInsurance.faqAnswer7: No, guests are covered by the host's tier coverage during trips. However, guests can purchase optional protection at checkout for reduced deductibles and 50% off their security deposit.
SupportInsurance.faqQuestion8: What happens if a guest damages my car?
SupportInsurance.faqAnswer8: Document the damage with photos before the guest leaves if possible. File a claim through the app immediately. The guest's security deposit can be applied toward repairs, and insurance covers amounts beyond the deposit up to policy limits.
SupportInsurance.faqQuestion9: Is coverage different for luxury/exotic cars?
SupportInsurance.faqAnswer9: Yes. High-value vehicles ($75K+) have higher deposits ($500-$2,500), require enhanced guest verification, and may have specific repair requirements (factory-authorized shops only). Coverage limits remain the same.
SupportInsurance.faqQuestion10: Can I upgrade my insurance tier?
SupportInsurance.faqAnswer10: Yes! Upload proof of P2P or commercial insurance through your host dashboard. Once verified (1-2 business days), your tier upgrades immediately and you'll earn more on future trips.
SupportInsurance.needImmediateHelpDesc: For accidents involving injuries, call 911 first. Then contact our claims team.

SupportInsuranceCoverage.liabilityCoverageDesc: Included with every rental. Covers bodily injury and property damage to third parties.
SupportInsuranceCoverage.liabilityDetail1: Required by law in all states
SupportInsuranceCoverage.liabilityDetail2: Protects you if you cause an accident
SupportInsuranceCoverage.liabilityDetail3: Covers other drivers, passengers, and property
SupportInsuranceCoverage.comprehensiveProtectionDesc: Optional coverage for non-collision damage like theft, vandalism, or weather.
SupportInsuranceCoverage.collisionProtectionDesc: Optional coverage for damage from accidents, regardless of fault.
SupportInsuranceCoverage.byoiDesc: Already have personal auto insurance? You may be able to use it for your rental and receive a 50% discount on the security deposit.
SupportInsuranceCoverage.byoiReq1: Your policy must include comprehensive and collision coverage
SupportInsuranceCoverage.byoiReq2: Coverage must extend to rental vehicles
SupportInsuranceCoverage.byoiReq3: You'll need to provide proof of insurance during booking

SupportModifyReservation.title: Modify a Reservation
SupportModifyReservation.subtitle: Change dates, times, or cancel your booking
SupportModifyReservation.howToModifyStep1: Log into your ItWhip account and go to "My Trips"
SupportModifyReservation.howToModifyStep2: Find the reservation you want to modify
SupportModifyReservation.howToModifyStep3: Click "Modify Reservation" and select new dates/times
SupportModifyReservation.howToModifyStep4: Review any price changes and confirm the modification
SupportModifyReservation.whatCanBeModifiedItem1: • Pickup and return dates (subject to vehicle availability)
SupportModifyReservation.whatCanBeModifiedItem3: • Pickup location (if host offers multiple options)
SupportModifyReservation.importantNotesItem1: • Modifications must be made at least 24 hours before pickup
SupportModifyReservation.importantNotesItem2: • Price may change based on new dates and availability
SupportModifyReservation.importantNotesItem3: • Some hosts may not allow modifications close to the trip date

SupportPayments.title: Payment Methods
SupportPayments.subtitle: Accepted payment options
SupportPayments.securityDepositsDescription: A security deposit hold is placed on your card when you book. This is released 3-5 business days after your trip ends, assuming no damage.
SupportPayments.depositByoi: • BYOI discount: 50% off deposit if you provide your own insurance
SupportPayments.paymentSecurityDescription: All payments are processed securely through Stripe. We never store your full card details. Your payment information is encrypted with bank-level security (256-bit SSL).

SupportRoadside.title: Roadside Assistance
SupportRoadside.subtitle: 24/7 emergency help when you need it
SupportRoadside.step1: Pull over to a safe location away from traffic
SupportRoadside.step3: Call our roadside assistance line or use the ItWhip app
SupportRoadside.step4: Provide your location and describe the issue
SupportRoadside.step5: Wait in a safe location for help to arrive
SupportRoadside.serviceFlatTireDesc: We'll send help to change your tire with the spare, or tow if no spare is available.
SupportRoadside.serviceJumpStartDesc: Dead battery? We'll send someone to jump start your vehicle and get you back on the road.
SupportRoadside.serviceLockoutDesc: Locked your keys in the car? We'll send a locksmith to get you back in.
SupportRoadside.serviceFuelDeliveryDesc: Run out of gas? We'll deliver enough fuel to get you to the nearest station.
SupportRoadside.serviceTowingDesc: If the vehicle can't be fixed on-site, we'll arrange towing to the nearest repair facility.

SupportVehicleIssues.title: Vehicle Issues
SupportVehicleIssues.subtitle: What to do if something goes wrong
SupportVehicleIssues.emergencyDescription: If you're in immediate danger, call 911 first.
SupportVehicleIssues.firstStep1: Pull over to a safe location if you're driving
SupportVehicleIssues.firstStep3: Contact the host through the ItWhip app
SupportVehicleIssues.firstStep4: If you can't reach the host, contact ItWhip support
SupportVehicleIssues.issueFlatTireDesc: Pull over safely. Check if the vehicle has a spare. Contact roadside assistance if you need help changing it.
SupportVehicleIssues.issueDeadBatteryDesc: Contact roadside assistance for a jump start. Do not attempt to jump the car yourself unless you know how.
SupportVehicleIssues.issueCheckEngineDesc: If the car is running normally, you can continue to a safe location. Contact the host and report the issue.
SupportVehicleIssues.issueStrangeNoisesDesc: Pull over and assess. Contact the host to describe the noise. Do not continue driving if it seems unsafe.
SupportVehicleIssues.issueAccidentDesc: Ensure everyone is safe. Call 911 if needed. Document everything and contact ItWhip support immediately.

SupportVerification.phoneVerificationDesc: Verify your phone number via SMS code. This helps us keep your account secure.
SupportVerification.identityVerificationDesc: Upload a photo of your government-issued ID (passport or state ID). We verify your identity to protect all users.
SupportVerification.driversLicenseDesc: Upload front and back photos of your valid driver's license. Must be current and match your profile name.
SupportVerification.requirement1: Must be 21+ years old (25+ for some vehicles)
SupportVerification.requirement2: Valid driver's license for at least 2 years
